page.title: 21Rowing boats on Raby Mere
page.content:
In the 1940's and probably for many years before the war Raby Mere was part of a popular recreation area. There were rowing boats for hire and a cafe in the grounds of the cottage next door. I remember going on the swing boats there and putting pennies in the slot machines before we emigrated in 1941. When my parents died in South Africa their ashes were brought back to the Wirral and scattered near the Mere. It is now a private fishing lake and a peaceful place to feed the ducks and other water birds.
Contribution by: Hazel Fuller
